paragraphs.text: Foie gras is exactly as delicious as you've heard. It should nonetheless be banned.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a US judge struck down California's 2 1/2 year old foie gras ban on Wednesday
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: a Napa Valley chef said he'd been "jumping up and down for 90 minutes."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I'll bet you were, dude
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Foie gras hits you in your animal pleasure center with the force of a bullet train and gives you, experientially, a high closer to that of a narcotic than sexual gratification
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I was 19 and at le Grand Vefour, the legendary Parisian restaurant, when I first ate foie gras
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: An unassuming ceramic tub of what looked and smelled a bit like cat food arrived at the table with a glass of Sauternes the color of a hepatitis patient's urine to wash it down
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My first, tentative, nibble of foie gras resists any food critic hyperbole for which I could reach to describe how wonderful it was - and has been every time since
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: You can't argue convincingly with the extraordinarily pleasurable experience of eating foie gras
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you also can't argue convincingly - although many foodies try- that gavage, the force-feeding process which produces the stuff, isn't torture or, at at minimum, animal cruelty of a most hideous type
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am an unapologetic omnivore who worships at the altar of good (and "bad") food - so, hardly an animal rights advocate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I believe that, for the most part, people have the right to to put what they want in their mouths
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the State of California was correct to ban foie gras
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I sincerely hope Attorney General Kamala Harris fights to get the ban reinstated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Contemplate gavage for a moment
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for two or three weeks, migratory birds (ducks, geese) are kept in cages
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Three times a day they have steel funnels shoved down their throats
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: an auger is turned
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are force fed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The birds' livers grow enormous - eventually taking up half the space of their lower body
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Aquatic birds, like ducks and geese, evolved as creatures who spend most of their time on the water, only occasionally foraging on land
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: They are social animals who like to hang out in groups, preen and communicate with each other via display and call
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Sitting in a cage for a few weeks being force-fed is a horrible fate for any sentient being
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is particularly nasty for these migratory birds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some foie gras lovers argue that gavage can be ethical
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: there are "good" poultry farmers who use flexible plastic tubes instead of steel to force feed birds who get to roam around barns
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Anthony Bourdain famously commented that "you see worse [than gavage] in the pay-per-view film on the hotel channel- and that's people, for God's sake"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: (Presumably he was referring to fellatio)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then there's the "civilized" cultures argument: the ancient Egyptians, the Greeks, the Romans used gavage to produce foie gras, therefore as a similarly "civilized" culture we should be similarly allowed to force feed birds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Possibly the most specious argument against the California ban came from the plaintiffs' lawyer, Michael Tenenbaum
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who called the ruling " a victory for freedom."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Tenenbaum wasn't ad-libbing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: many chefs and foodies have held that banning foie gras is the equivalent to "cultural imperialism" and is an abridgment of their basic rights
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Tenenbaum, too, truly believes that
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , he should be litigating for chefs' rights to make shark fin soup,
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: fry up songbirds, pour boiling oil into live monkeys' brains, and in general cook up anything they damn well please
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I get nervous when people - even really smart, talented people - use the word "freedom" to mean"I get to do what I want"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the case of foie gras bans, the argument is that, because this food is so delicious, you get to eat it, cook with it, produce it and make money off it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - no matter that it's produced as the result of an inhumane practice
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which has been documented by scientists as causing severe, prolonged suffering to animals
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The discontent of civilization, as Freud once pointed out, is that we don't all get to do what we want
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The price of getting to live among our fellow humans in a truly civilized society is that we have to repress some of our urges
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I love everything about eating foie gras
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I do it rarely
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I look forward to the day when I won't be able to find it on a menu
paragraphs.label: assumption
